      Installing pytorch with CUDA on Anaconda

      1 minute read

      The following guide shows you how to install pytorch with CUDA under the Anaconda 2 virtual environment.

      Assumptions

      • Ubuntu OS
      • NVIDIA GPU with CUDA support
      • Anaconda 2 (see installation instructions here)
      • CUDA (installed by system admin)

      Specifications

      This guide is written for the following specs:

      • Ubuntu 16.04
      • Python 2.7
      • CUDA 8
      • cuDNN v7.1
      • Anaconda 2
      • OpenCV3

      Guide

      First, get cuDNN by following this cuDNN Guide.

      Let’s create a virtual Anaconda environment called “pytorch”:

      For our non-standard installation of cuDNN, we need to tell pytorch where to look for libcudart via the environment variable $LD_LIBRARY_PATH. Let’s tell Anaconda to set that every time we activate ‘pytorch’ and unset that everytime we deactivate the environment

      Let’s enter our environment directory and do the following:

      Edit ./etc/conda/activate.d/env_vars.sh as follows:

      Edit ./etc/conda/deactivate.d/env_vars.sh as follows:

      We are now ready to activate the virtual environment:

      Now let’s install the necessary dependencies in our current pytorch environment:

      Let’s clone the pytorch repo into our home directory:

      We are now ready to install pytorch via the very convenient installer in the repo:

      We are now ready to test if pytorch has been installed correctly with CUDA

      If you are also installing torchvision:
